text: The report says the earthquake struck the island at 5:11 p.m. local time. The U.S. Geological Survey put the quake's strength at magnitude-5.4. Monday's earthquake was the second one to hit Qeshm in the past 24 hours. Earlier on Sunday a 5.6 quake jolted the island, some 930 miles south of the capital, Tehran.
title: Iran's state television says a magnitude-5.2 quake has injured three people in the Persian Gulf Island of Qeshm.
